name: ListServiceChangeEvents
description:
Retrieve existing change events for a service.

Use this tool to list all change events associated with a specified service. Typically used to monitor or audit changes within a service. Requires `services.read` OAuth scope.

parameters.name: service_resource_id
parameters.description: The ID of the service resource to retrieve change events for. This ID is mandatory for identifying the specific service.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: The `Accept` header for versioning the API calls. Use this to specify the version of the API you are targeting.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: The Content-Type header value. Should be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: start_date_utc
parameters.description: The start of the date range to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Returns an error for non-UTC datetimes.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for the search (UTC ISO 8601 datetime). Must be in UTC; non-UTC format will cause an error.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of results to display per page in the response.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination for search results. Use this to specify the starting point for results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: filter_by_team_ids
parameters.description: An array of team IDs to filter results. Only returns data for specified teams. Requires 'teams' ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: integration_ids
parameters.description: An array of integration IDs to filter events by related integrations.

value_schema.description: An array of integration IDs. Only results related to these integrations will be returned.

parameters.name: include_total_in_pagination
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses for complete result counts.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search, as a UTC ISO 8601 datetime string. Will return an HTTP 400 for non-UTC datetimes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: team_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: integration_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of integration IDs. Only results related to these integrations will be returned.

value_schema.description: An array of integration IDs. Only results related to these integrations will be returned.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
